item.title: Comment on Instagram Launches Rebrand (and the world loses their minds) by Ben Butler
item.dc:creator: Ben Butler
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/instagram-launches-rebrand-world-loses-minds/?path=%2Fbuiltbytophat%2Finstagram-launches-rebrand-world-loses-minds%2F/#comment-4933">Jason Mollica</a>.
Thanks for sharing, Jason!
I thought it was an extremely interesting concept for the "color to come from the photos" exclusively as well. It really puts the end-user at the focal point of the story.
It's the classic reaction I think. I look to Spotify and Uber as case studies. When they both made brand tweaks, the internet lost their collective minds like they did here. I can't help but wonder if any rebrand to any beloved brand would garner mass praise, or if every brand is destined for mass criticism (at least initially).

item.title: Comment on Instagram Launches Rebrand (and the world loses their minds) by Jason Mollica
item.dc:creator: Jason Mollica
item.description:
Change is good. Frankly, while I liked the old logo, the new one is quite colorful. I appreciated Instagram saying that they want to color to come from your photos, not the background. That is actually the first thing I noticed. It is as if the white border is a frame now.
But, heaven forbid a brand change their logo without social media approving.
